content: English cricketer **Mark John Hayley Weedon** (born 28 October 1940) is an English former [cricketer](/wiki/Cricket) who played [first-class cricket](/wiki/First-class_cricket) for [Cambridge University](/wiki/Cambridge_University_Cricket_Club) in 1961 and 1962. Weedon was born in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) after his mother had been evacuated from [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong), where his father, Martin Pryce Weedon, was a [captain](/wiki/Captain_(British_Army_and_Royal_Marines)) in the [Middlesex Regiment](/wiki/Middlesex_Regiment). His parents were separated and estranged during the [Second World War](/wiki/Second_World_War), and later made new marriages. He attended [Harrow School](/wiki/Harrow_School) before going up to [Magdalene College, Cambridge](/wiki/Magdalene_College,_Cambridge). He played one full season for Cambridge in 1962, when he took 36 wickets with his medium-pace bowling and was noted for his perseverance. His best bowling figures came in the opening match of the 1962 season when he took 5 for 67 against [Surrey](/wiki/Surrey_County_Cricket_Club). After receiving an [MA](/wiki/Master_of_Arts) from Cambridge, Weedon earned an [MBA](/wiki/Master_of_Business_Administration) from [Harvard](/wiki/Harvard_University) and began a career in business as a consultant and executive. He founded and ran the company BoardSearch, which specialised in senior executive appointments. Weedon married Julie McLeod in May 1971. He is a cousin of the actresses [Hayley Mills](/wiki/Hayley_Mills) and [Juliet Mills](/wiki/Juliet_Mills). Their mothers were sisters. - Mark Weedon at [ESPNcricinfo](/wiki/ESPNcricinfo) - Mark Weedon at CricketArchive
title: Mark Weedon (cricketer)
